title: Add image upload to the success modal and capitalize Annammooo in the homepage prompt

requirements.text: Update the homepage question text to use the capitalized name "Annammooo" instead of "annammooo" (keep the rest of the text unchanged).

quotes: also change the name annammooo to Annammooo

acceptanceCriteria: The homepage headline renders exactly: "Annammooo will you be my valentine" (same wording as before, with only the name’s capitalization changed).
No other user-facing text is changed as part of this requirement.

requirements.text: Add a client-side image upload/picker in the success modal (the second response screen shown after clicking "Yes") that allows the user to select an image from their device and preview it in the modal, similar to the existing homepage image picker behavior.

quotes: I need to add a custom image of ours on the second response page as well so add an option to upload an image in the second page

acceptanceCriteria: When the success modal is open, the image area in the modal provides a visible control to choose an image from the user’s device (via a file picker).
After a valid image is selected, the modal displays the selected image as a preview (client-side only; no backend upload).
If the user selects a non-image file, an English, user-friendly inline error message is shown within the modal.
If the selected image file is too large or cannot be previewed, an English, user-friendly inline error message is shown within the modal.
The modal continues to work as before: escape key closes it, clicking the backdrop closes it, and the close (X) button closes it.
The new modal image picker does not break or interfere with the existing homepage image picker.

constraints: Frontend must not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not serve images from the backend; image selection must remain client-side preview only.
Backend is single-actor Motoko; no backend changes are required for this request.
nonGoals: Persisting uploaded images across page refreshes or across devices/sessions.
Uploading images to the Internet Computer backend or any external storage.
Adding new routes or multi-page navigation beyond the existing modal-based second response screen.
